page.title: 09STOCKING GREEN FARM
page.content: Stocking Green Farm has 510 acres of mainly arable land,with 60 acres of grass land, dressed with nitrogen and farmyard manure from the cowsheds. Grass is cut for hay.wheat,oats and barley are grown,with 30 acres of high protein Tic beans. 50% of these are expoted to Egypt and Israel and the rest are fed into pigeon trays.No horticultural crops are grown as the soil is too heavy.Hares partridge ducks and peewits can be seen. There is a large pond and a brook.The cattle are Herefords and Charolais,with 14 suckler cows,and calves which are bought in and reared until two years old.They run about 40 sheep. Pastureland is enclosed by hedges,mainly hawthorn,and there are a few ash trees. Several horses are kept. The motorway goes through the corner of one field.
